reviews.review_msg: Delgrande is a solid prof with a very dry sense of humor. I found myself laughing several times in his classes. Overall I enjoyed his lectures though they could be a bit boring at times. The assignments and midterm/final were fair and not too difficult.

In my opinion he's fine at best. I actually liked the class a lot. But, at least for me, his answers to any questions (during lectures of office hours) were useless because he just repeats himself. Assignments (especially programming assignments) were really fun. Exams were fair.
First class I failed in 4 years at SFU. This is probably my fault, although I did attend every lecture. Got an A- in the other class I was taking that semester so...
